abstract: Former Central Intelligence Agency officer Jeffrey A Sterling is convicted of espionage; was charged with leaking information concerning an operation to disrupt Iran's nuclear program to New York Times reporter James Risen, who later revealed information in book; conviction amounts to significant victory for the Obama administration, crowning its crackdown on unauthorized leaks.
lead_paragraph: Jeffrey A. Sterling was convicted of espionage on charges that he told a New York Times reporter about a secret operation to disrupt Iran’s nuclear program.

byline.contributor: Scott Shane and Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting.

snippet: Jeffrey A. Sterling was convicted of espionage on charges that he told a New York Times reporter about a secret operation to disrupt Iran’s nuclear program.

keywords.value: State of War: The Secret History of the CIA and the Bush Administration (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

headline.main: C.I.A. Officer Is Found Guilty in Leak Tied to Times Reporter
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Officer Guilty in Leak Tied to Reporter
